articles.title: Algeria appoints new government amid worst political crisis in decades
articles.description: Algeria appointed a new government on Thursday, as the country faces its biggest political crisis in decades and a raft of economic problems caused by falling energy revenues.
articles.content:
ALGIERS (Reuters) - Algeria appointed a new government on Thursday, as the country faces its biggest political crisis in decades and a raft of economic problems caused by falling energy revenues.

articles.title: England opener Burns to miss rest of South Africa tour
articles.description: England's 'cursed' tour of South Africa continued on Thursday after opening batsman Rory Burns was ruled out for the remainder of the four-test series with an ankle injury sustained while playing football.
articles.content:
CAPE TOWN (Reuters) - England’s ‘cursed’ tour of South Africa continued on Thursday after opening batsman Rory Burns was ruled out for the remainder of the four-test series with an ankle injury sustained while playing football.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: South African photographer kidnapped in Syria back home - source
articles.description: A South African photojournalist kidnapped in Syria by Islamic State three years ago returned home on Thursday with the help of Turkey's intelligence agency, a security source in Ankara said.
articles.content:
ANKARA (Reuters) - A South African photojournalist kidnapped in Syria by Islamic State three years ago returned home on Thursday with the help of Turkey’s intelligence agency, a security source in Ankara said.

articles.title: Atlantia's motorway concession must be revoked: deputy minister
articles.description: Atlantia's motorway concession must be revoked and the Italian government will make the decision in the coming days, Italy's Deputy Transport Minister Giancarlo Cancelleri said in an interview on Friday.
articles.content:
MILAN (Reuters) - Atlantia’s motorway concession must be revoked and the Italian government will make the decision in the coming days, Italy’s Deputy Transport Minister Giancarlo Cancelleri said in an interview on Friday.

articles.title: Rouhani says Iran more determined to resist U.S. after Soleimani's death
articles.description: Iran will be more determined to resist the United States, Iranian President Hassan Rouhani said on Friday, in response to the killing of Quds Force chief Qassem Soleimani in Iraq, Iranian state television reported.
articles.content:
DUBAI (Reuters) - Iran will be more determined to resist the United States, Iranian President Hassan Rouhani said on Friday, in response to the killing of Quds Force chief Qassem Soleimani in Iraq, Iranian state television reported.

articles.title: Military plane crash in Sudan's West Darfur leaves 18 dead
articles.description: A military transport plane crashed on Thursday after taking off from an airport in Sudan's West Darfur, killing 18 people on board, according to the military.
articles.content:
KHARTOUM (Reuters) - A military transport plane crashed on Thursday after taking off from an airport in Sudan’s West Darfur, killing 18 people on board, according to the military.

articles.title: U.S. farmers see another bleak year despite Phase 1 trade deal

articles.title: Chinese companies' hedging activities spike amid trade war uncertainty -data
articles.description: Corporate China's hedging activities spiked over the past two years as the Sino-U.S. trade war and a slowing economy prompted companies to embrace the country's rapidly growing derivative market to reduce uncertainty, data shows.
articles.content:
SHANGHAI (Reuters) - Corporate China’s hedging activities spiked over the past two years as the Sino-U.S. trade war and a slowing economy prompted companies to embrace the country’s rapidly growing derivative market to reduce uncertainty, data shows.

articles.title: Veolia buys some U.S. waste treatment assets from Alcoa
articles.description: French utility Veolia said it had agreed to buy Alcoa USA Corporation's hazardous waste treatment business located in Arkansas, in a $250 million deal.
articles.content:
PARIS (Reuters) - French utility Veolia (VIE.PA) said it had agreed to buy Alcoa USA Corporation’s (AA.N) hazardous waste treatment business located in Arkansas, in a $250 million deal. 
Veolia said the facility currently employs 73 people, and added that th… [+311 chars]

articles.title: Credit Suisse announces $1 billion 2020 share buyback program
articles.description: Credit Suisse said on Friday it expects to buy back at least 1 billion Swiss francs ($1.03 billion) worth of shares until the end of 2020, subject to market and economic conditions, after completing a similar program last year.
articles.content:
ZURICH (Reuters) - Credit Suisse (CSGN.S) said on Friday it expects to buy back at least 1 billion Swiss francs ($1.03 billion) worth of shares until the end of 2020, subject to market and economic conditions, after completing a similar program last year.

ZURICH, Jan 3 (Reuters) - Sunrise Communications Chief Executive Olaf Swantee resigned and Chairman Peter Kurer will not run for re-election after the Swiss telecommunications company failed in its $6.3 billion bid to buy the Swiss unit of Liberty Global.
